answers.answer: Hi!If neurological causes have been ruled out, then this could be an allergic reaction to bra material which has spread to neighboring areas. It could also be an infection under skin called cellulitis. You need to rule out diabetes as this metabolic disease predisposes to allergy and infection. Calamine lotions and other over the counter preparations with camphor/menthol may help reduce the sensitivity. If they do, then in all probability this is an allergic reaction. Please discuss this with your treating doctor. The possibility of shingles should be re-investigated if allergy/infection is ruled out. Take care!

question: About 3 weeks ago a small patch of skin under the band of my bra, felt as if it were sunburnt, this sensation is now from the center of by back, between the shoulders, stretching around the side, through arm pit, over left breast to the sternum.  Shingles has been ruled out. All blood testing came back normal, message aggravates area. Even pain medication does not help. I do have degenerative disc disease and have had 2 surgeries , first at age 35, a yr ago at 57. I am in good health, eating healthy diet. I am in PT now with no help to the thoracic area. The doc feels it is neuropothy. Has anyone experience this
title: Sensitive skin & Painful Spots
